name: pudding
content:
pudding noun
(SWEET FOOD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 [ C or U ] mainly UK a sweet and usually hot dish made with pastry, flour, bread, or rice, and often fruit: a sticky toffee/treacle pudding Is there any more rice pudding?
travellinglight/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
[ U ] US a sweet, soft food made from milk, sugar, eggs, and flavouring, eaten cold: chocolate/vanilla/butterscotch pudding
Creativ Studio Heinemann/GettyImages
[ U ] UK (informal pud) the final part of a meal, when a sweet dish is eaten: What's for pudding? I thought we'd have trifle for pudding. Synonym
dessert
More examplesFewer examplesThe pudding was delicately flavoured with vanilla.Any more pudding would simply be excessive.Grate some nutmeg on top of the pudding.That rice pudding was the first solid food he's eaten since his operation.
